author: FE Online
title: Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017: Phulpur constituency; SP’s Mansoor Alam takes on BJP’s Masroor Shaikh; All you need to know
text:
Uttar pradesh assembly elections 2017 Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017: Phulpur constituency; SP’s Mansoor Alam takes on BJP’s Masroor Shaikh; All you need to know Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017: Phulpur constituency; SP’s Mansoor Alam takes on BJP’s Masroor Shaikh; All you need to know Phulpur is constituency No. 256 of Uttar Pradesh legislative assembly. The assembly constituency is a part of Allahabad district and comes under Phulpur Lok Sabha constituency. It is an open constituency. By: FE Online | Published: February 22, 2017 12:45 PM Phulpur is constituency No. 256 of Uttar Pradesh legislative assembly. The assembly constituency is a part of Allahabad district and comes under Phulpur Lok Sabha constituency. It is an open constituency. (Source: PTI) 
The super heated political campaigning, accentuated by personal jibes, finally came to an end on February 21 as the fourth phase of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections is all set to polls on Thursday. The voting will take place in 53 Assembly constituency spread across 12 districts of the state. Districts going to polls in the fourth phase are Pratapgarh, Kaushambi, Allahabad, Mahoba, Banda, Hamirpur, Jalaun, Jhansi, Lalitpur, Chitrakoot and Fatehpur. The key parties to watch out for during the elections are Samajwadi Party (SP), Bharatiya Janata Party ( BJP ), Congress , Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP). Over the past few months, PM Narendra Modi , UP CM Akhilesh Yadav and BSP supremo Mayawati has been among the host of leaders who have kept the balls rolling for their respective parties. These political figures have put high stake in order to lure voters of the politically crucial state. The ongoing polls are touted to be a litmus test for the SP government as the party has recently come out from a family feud. PM Modi-led BJP has also emerged as a strong competitor for the ruling party in the state. Akhilesh, on his own has managed to build an image of ‘leader for youth’ and have gained a huge vote bank in various regions of the state. BJP’s star campaigner, PM Modi, during his surged campaigning spree has constantly targeted the SP-Congress alliance and the BSP for corruption in their regime. 
Making in a crucial three-way contest, Mayawati-led BSP has cemented itself as one of lead contenders in this political run. However, the party is still behind in terms of vote bank apart from some particular communities. Even the votes of Muslim community have gone to her in limited areas where the candidates fielded are very strong. The high-octane assembly elections are in full swing in India’s most populous state and is expected to lay the cornerstone for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. While SP aims at retaining its power, this time with the Congress, both BJP and BSP are fighting to make a comeback. 
Phulpur is constituency No. 256 of Uttar Pradesh legislative assembly. The assembly constituency is a part of Allahabad district and comes under Phulpur Lok Sabha constituency. It is an open constituency. 
Number of voters The Phulpur constituency has 3,72,093 registered voters. 
What are the key issues Development, unemployment and absence of basic civic amenities are some of the major issues in this constituency. 
Who was the winner last time SP won the constituency by a margin of 7,900 votes during the 2012 Assembly elections. Sayeed Ahamad from SP bagged a total of 72,898 votes followed by Praveen Patel from BSP who got 64,998 votes. 
You might also want to see this: 
Who are the competing candidates Mansoor Alam (SP), Pramod Chandra (RLD), Mohammed Masroor Shaikh (BSP) and Praveen Kumar Singh (BJP). 
Why this constituency is important? Phulpur constituency has always seen a tough fight between SP and BSP from 1993 to 2012. BJP had never won this assembly seat. However, this time the saffron party has fielded an ex-BSP MLA making the fight triangular. Please Wait while comments are loading...
